summary:
**Meeting Overview**:  
The City Plan Commission of Dallas will convene on November 7, 2024, for a briefing at 9:30 AM followed by a public hearing at 12:30 PM. The meeting will be held both in-person at City Hall and via videoconference, focusing on various zoning cases, subdivision applications, and other planning matters.

**Key Agenda Items**:  
The agenda includes the approval of minutes from previous meetings, multiple zoning cases categorized into consent, under advisement, and individual items, as well as subdivision cases and certificates of appropriateness for signs. Significant topics include proposed amendments to existing Planned Development Districts and new Specific Use Permits.

**Important Details**:  
Notable proposals include applications for a Planned Development District for agricultural and retail uses, amendments to Planned Development District No. 456, and Specific Use Permits for a mini-warehouse and vehicle display. The commission will also review several residential replats and a historic overlay for the Bianchi House.

**Action Items**:  
The commission seeks approvals for various zoning cases, including consent items (items 2-4), under advisement cases (items 5-10), and individual cases (items 11-14). Additionally, the commission will consider appointments to its committees. Public testimony will be allowed, and participants must register in advance to speak. 

Overall, the meeting aims to address significant urban planning and zoning issues impacting the Dallas community.
